query.result:
1 'Deus, venerunt gentes', alternating 2 or three or four sweet psalmody, 3 the women began, and weeping;
4 and Beatrice, sighing and pious, 5 listened to them so that little 6 more at the cross Mary changed.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
7 Ma poi che l’altre vergini dier loco 8 a lei di dir, levata dritta in pè, 9 rispuose, colorata come foco:
10 ‘Modicum, et non videbitis me; 11 et iterum, sorelle mie dilette, 12 modicum, et vos videbitis me’.
query.result:
7 But after the other virgins gave place 8 to her to speak, standing up straight on her feet, 9 she replied, colored like fire:
10 ‘A little while, and you will not see me; 11 and again, my dear sisters, 12 a little while, and you will see me’.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
13 Poi le si mise innanzi tutte e sette, 14 e dopo sé, solo accennando, mosse 15 me e la donna e ’l savio che ristette.
query.result: 13 Then she placed herself before all seven of them, 14 and after her, just beckoning, she moved 15 me and the lady and the wise man who stayed behind.

16 Thus she went; and I do not believe that her 17 tenth step had been placed on the ground, 18 when with her eyes she struck my eyes;
19 and with a tranquil expression "Come faster", 20 she said to me, "so that, if I speak to you, 21 you may be well-disposed to listen to me".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
22 Sì com’ io fui, com’ io dovëa, seco, 23 dissemi: «Frate, perché non t’attenti 24 a domandarmi omai venendo meco?».
query.result: 22 As soon as I was, as I should have been, with her, 23 she said to me: "Brother, why don't you dare 24 to ask me questions now that you are coming with me?".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
25 Come a color che troppo reverenti 26 dinanzi a suo maggior parlando sono, 27 che non traggon la voce viva ai denti,
28 avvenne a me, che sanza intero suono 29 incominciai: «Madonna, mia bisogna 30 voi conoscete, e ciò ch’ad essa è buono».
query.result:
25 Like someone who is too reverent 26 when speaking before his superior, 27 who cannot force his voice from his teeth,
28 it happened to me that without a full sound 29 I began: "My lady, you know my need 30 and what is good for it".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.

query.result: 31 And she to me: "I want you to free yourself from fear and shame, 32 so that you no longer speak like someone who is dreaming.

query.result: 34 Know that the vessel that the serpent broke, 35 was and is not; but whoever is to blame for it, let him believe 36 that God's vengeance does not fear bribes.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
37 Non sarà tutto tempo sanza reda 38 l’aguglia che lasciò le penne al carro, 39 per che divenne mostro e poscia preda;
40 ch’io veggio certamente, e però il narro, 41 a darne tempo già stelle propinque, 42 secure d’ogn’ intoppo e d’ogne sbarro,
43 nel quale un cinquecento diece e cinque, 44 messo di Dio, anciderà la fuia 45 con quel gigante che con lei delinque.

query.result:
46 And perhaps my dark narration, 47 like Themis and the Sphinx, persuades you less, 48 because it dulls the intellect in their way;
49 but soon the Naiads will be fierce, 50 who will solve this strong enigma 51 without harm to sheep or crops.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
52 Tu nota; e sì come da me son porte, 53 così queste parole segna a’ vivi 54 del viver ch’è un correre a la morte.
query.result: 52 You take note; and just as they are spoken by me, 53 so mark these words to the living 54 of the life that is a race to death.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
55 E aggi a mente, quando tu le scrivi, 56 di non celar qual hai vista la pianta 57 ch’è or due volte dirubata quivi.
query.result: 55 And keep in mind, when you write them, 56 not to hide what you have seen of the plant 57 that has now been robbed twice here.

58 Qualunque ruba quella o quella schianta, 59 con bestemmia di fatto offende a Dio, 60 che solo a l’uso suo la creò santa.
query.result: 58 Whoever steals that or tears that off, 59 with the very act offends God with blasphemy, 60 who created it holy for his use alone.

query.result: 61 To bite that, in punishment and desire 62 for five thousand years and more the first soul 63 yearned for the one who punished the bite in himself.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
64 Dorme lo ’ngegno tuo, se non estima 65 per singular cagione esser eccelsa 66 lei tanto e sì travolta ne la cima.
query.result: 64 Your intellect is asleep, if it does not consider 65 that for a singular reason she is so exalted 66 and so turned upside down at the top.

85 "So that you may recognize," she said, "that school 86 that you have followed, and see its doctrine 87 how it can follow my word;

103 E più corusco e con più lenti passi 104 teneva il sole il cerchio di merigge, 105 che qua e là, come li aspetti, fassi,

query.result:

107 when they fixed their eyes, just as one fixes his eyes 108 who goes before people as a guide 109 if he finds something new or its traces,
109 the seven ladies at the end of a pale shadow, 110 such as the Alps bear over their cold streams 111 under green leaves and black branches.

query.result: 112 Before them I seemed to see the Euphrates and Tigris 113 emerge from a fountain, 114 and, like friends, lazily part ways.

query.result:
118 To such a request it was said to me: "Ask 119 Matelda to tell you". And here she replied, 120 as one who frees himself from blame,
121 the beautiful lady: "This and other things 122 were told to him by me; and I am sure 123 that the water of Lethe did not hide it from him".

130 Like a gentle soul, who does not make excuses, 131 but makes his desire the desire of others 132 as soon as it is revealed by a sign;
133 so, after I was taken by her, 134 the beautiful lady moved, and to Statius 135 she said graciously: "Come with him".

136 If I had, reader, more space 137 to write, I would still sing in part 138 of the sweet drink that would never satisfy me;
139 but because all the pages 140 woven for this second canticle are full, 141 the bridle of art no longer lets me go further.

query.result:
142 I returned from the most holy wave 143 remade like new plants 144 renewed with new leaves,
